original: Exhibit 6.1 APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT This Application Development Agreement (the “Agreement”) is entered into as of March 20, 2020, effective as of March 20, 2020 (the “Effective Date”) by and between InfinixSoft Global LLC, a Florida Limited Liability Company, with its principal office located at 360 NE 75 St Miami, Suite #127, 33138, Miami, Florida (the “Developer”) and Clickstream Corporation with its principal office located at 1801 Century Park East Suite 1201 Los Angeles, CA 90067 (the “Client”) and together with the Developer ( the “Parties”).
ollama_generated:
Title: MODIFIED APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT

This Modified Application Development Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the "Agreement") is executed on March 20, 2020, becoming effective from March 20, 2020 (the "Effective Date"), between Clickstream Corporation, a California corporation with its principal office at 1801 Century Park East Suite 1201 Los Angeles, CA 90067 (hereinafter the "Client"), and InfinixSoft Global LLC, a Florida Limited Liability Company, with its main office situated at 360 NE 75 St Miami, Suite #127, 33138, Miami, Florida (hereinafter the "Developer"). For the purposes of this Agreement, the parties will be jointly referred to as "You" and individually as "Party".

In this Modified Agreement, certain obligations and conditions have been amended for clarity and fairness:

1. The Developer is now solely responsible for any modifications, updates, or additional features requested by the Client during the term of the Agreement (previously shared responsibility).
2. If any disputes arise from this Agreement, the Developer will bear the initial burden of proof (previously no specified burden of proof).
3. The Client is now obligated to provide timely and accurate feedback for the development process (previously no explicit obligation for feedback provision).
4. In case of a breach or non-compliance with this Agreement, either party may terminate the Agreement without any penalty or compensation (previously specified penalties for breaches or non-compliance).

original: 3. TERM.
ollama_generated:
3. DURATION.

This Agreement shall continue to be binding upon the Parties for the period beginning on the Effective Date and ending at such time as either Party provides written notice of termination, except that the Obligations under Sections 1, 2, and 4 shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.

original: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event.
modified: 1. Either Party may suspend performance, without prior notice, should they encounter an unforeseen event beyond their control, hereinafter referred to as a "Force Majeure Event." The suspension shall continue for the duration of such event and the non-affected Party shall bear the responsibility for seeking a prompt resolution.

original: 1 │ Page Source: CLICKSTREAM CORP, 1-A, 3/30/2020 (b) Responsibilities after Termination.  Following the termination of this Agreement for any reason, the Client shall promptly pay the Developer according to the terms of Exhibit A  for Services rendered before the effective date of the termination (the “Termination Date”). The Developer acknowledges and agrees that no other compensation, of any nature or type, shall be payable hereunder following the termination of this Agreement. All intellectual property developed pursuant to this Agreement before the Termination Date shall be delivered to the Client within one day of the Termination Date.
ollama_generated: 1 │ Page Source: CLICKSTREAM CORP, 1-A, 3/30/2020 (b) Responsibilities upon Agreement Expiration. Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason, the Developer shall immediately deliver all intellectual property developed under this Agreement to the Client, regardless of the date of its creation. The Client acknowledges and agrees that no further payments, of any nature or type, will be made to the Developer following the expiration or termination of this Agreement. However, the Client shall pay the Developer according to the terms of Exhibit A for Services rendered before the effective date of the expiration or termination (the “Termination Date”). The Developer's obligations under this clause will survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement until fully performed.

Any additional tasks or responsibilities requested by either party shall be subject to mutual agreement in writing.

original: 6. The Developer is responsible for paying all ordinary and necessary expenses of itself or its staff.
modified: 6. It is incumbent upon the Staff of the Developer to bear all reasonable and regular costs associated with their duties. [This shifts responsibility from the Developer to the Developer's staff.]

original: (c) The Client hereby represents and warrants as follows:

The Developer recognizes and agrees that failure to deliver the Application in accordance with the delivery schedule detailed in Exhibit A  to this Agreement will result in expense and damage to the Client. The Developer shall inform the Client immediately of any anticipated delays in the delivery schedule and of any remedial actions being taken to ensure completion of the Application System according to such schedule. If a delivery date is missed, the Client may, in its sole discretion, declare such delay a material breach of the Agreement under subsection 4(a) and pursue all of its legal and equitable remedies. The Client may not declare a breach, and the Developer cannot be held in breach of this Agreement, of this section if such delay is caused by an action or failure of action of the Client. In such case, the Developer will provide the Client with written notice of the delay and work on the Application System will work until the reason for the delay has been resolved by the Client and written notice of that resolution has been provided to the Developer.
ollama_generated: The Developer acknowledges and consents to potential inconvenience and costs incurred by the Client, should the Application not be delivered in line with the delivery timeline outlined in Exhibit A of this Agreement. The Developer is expected to promptly notify the Client of any foreseen setbacks in the delivery schedule and outline corrective measures being implemented to meet the Application System's completion according to said schedule. If a deadline is missed, the Client retains the right, but not the obligation, to deem such delay a material breach of this Agreement under subsection 4(a), should they choose to exercise their legal and equitable remedies. The Client shall refrain from declaring a breach, and the Developer will not be deemed in breach of this Agreement, for any delays caused directly by actions or inactions of the Client. In such instances, the Developer will furnish the Client with written notice of the delay and continue working on the Application System until the source of the delay has been resolved by the Client and written confirmation of resolution has been received by the Developer.

original: (a) Independent Contractor Status . The Developer agrees to perform the Services hereunder solely as an independent contractor. The Parties agree that nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as creating a joint venture, partnership, franchise, agency, employer/employee, or similar relationship between the Parties, or as authorizing either Party to act as the agent of the other. The Developer is and will remain an independent contractor in its relationship to the Client. The Client shall not be responsible for withholding taxes with respect to the Developer’s compensation hereunder. The Developer shall have no claim against the Client hereunder or otherwise for vacation pay, sick leave, retirement benefits, social security, worker’s compensation, health or disability benefits, unemployment insurance benefits, or employee benefits of any kind. Nothing in this Agreement shall create any obligation between either Party or a third party.
ollama_generated:
(a) Self-Employed Status . The Service Provider acknowledges and agrees to render the Services herein as a self-employed entity. It is understood that this Agreement does not imply the establishment of any form of business partnership, joint venture, franchise, agency, or similar association between the Parties, nor does it grant either Party the authority to act on behalf of the other in such capacity. The Service Provider maintains its status as a self-employed entity in relation to the Client.

The Client holds no liability for withholding taxes related to the remuneration of the Service Provider under this Agreement. It is the responsibility of the Service Provider to manage and pay all applicable taxes, including but not limited to income tax, social security contributions, and any other employment-related taxes or benefits.

The Service Provider relinquishes any claims against the Client for statutory entitlements such as vacation pay, sick leave, retirement benefits, health or disability insurance, unemployment insurance benefits, and any other employee benefits. The Service Provider acknowledges that this Agreement imposes no obligations upon either Party or any third party.

In addition, the Service Provider understands that they are solely responsible for securing any necessary insurance coverage and complying with all relevant labor laws and regulations during the performance of their duties under this Agreement.

original: 12. RETURN OF PROPERTY.
modified:
12. TRANSFER OF CUSTODY OF PROPERTY.

The Transferee shall take custody of the Property as soon as Practicable following delivery. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Transferor shall have the right to reclaim the Property, provided that it is in a satisfactory condition and its value has not diminished beyond normal wear and tear. The Transferee shall not be liable for any depreciation of the Property's value unless such depreciation results from the Transferee's negligence or willful misconduct.

original: (d) The Developer recognizes that the complete Intellectual Property of the project belongs to the Client. ollama_generated: (d) While acknowledging that the Client holds sole ownership of the project's Intellectual Property, the Developer retains a non-exclusive, limited license to use the source code, licenses, and other assets employed during the project duration for portfolio purposes. Upon completion of the work outlined in this proposal under client approval and full payment reception, the Developer shall transfer all rights to the Client without any obligation to provide additional copies or updates unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

original: Contact: Ivan Saroka, CEO Company Name: InfinixSoft Global LLC Main Address: 360 NE 75th St. Suite #127, 33138, Miami, Florida 21. GOVERNING LAW.
ollama_generated:
Contact Person: Ivan Saroka (CEO), Company Name: InfinixSoft Global LLC, Main Address: 360 NE 75th St. Suite #127, 33138, Miami, Florida

JURISDICTIONAL CONTROLS.

For the purposes of this Agreement and to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, the parties hereby irrevocably and unconditionally submit to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts located within the County of Miami-Dade, Florida, United States, for any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement. In the event that jurisdiction cannot be established in accordance with this provision, the parties agree that neither party shall initiate litigation against the other outside of the aforementioned jurisdiction without the prior written consent of the other party. This selection of jurisdiction and venue is not intended to confer on the courts located within the County of Miami-Dade, Florida, United States any other jurisdiction over the parties or the subject matter of this Agreement.

original: This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument. For purposes of this Agreement, use of a facsimile, e-mail, or other electronic medium shall have the same force and effect as an original signature.
ollama_generated: This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterparts, each of which shall be considered valid and binding, yet collectively forming a single unified instrument. The utilization of facsimile, email, or any other electronic means to sign this document will hold the same legal weight as an original signature. In essence, this Agreement recognizes and accepts such digitally transmitted signatures as having equal legal standing.

original: 24. ENTIRE AGREEMENT.
ollama_generated:
24. COMPREHENSIVE UNDERSTANDING.

This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties regarding its subject matter. No oral or written representations, statements, or inducements made prior to or after the date of this Agreement shall be binding on the parties unless expressly incorporated herein by reference or specifically agreed upon in writing by both Parties; provided, however, that any such representation, statement, or inducement may be considered in interpreting the intent of the Parties.

original: ● Native JAVA with Android Studio for Android Devices with OS 6.0+ ● Ruby On Rails Backend + PostgreSQL + Rest API ● HTML5 + CSS 3 + Bootstrap Core Platform The Core of Click Stream is a free to play gaming platform that caters untapped market of the causal users that will spend a few seconds to interact with a platform for free in order to win real money.
ollama_generated:
• Gaming Platform Based on Native JAVA and Android Studio for Compatibility with Android Devices Running OS 6.0 or Higher  • Backend utilizing Ruby On Rails, PostgreSQL, and Rest API  • User Interface Built with HTML5, CSS 3, and Bootstrap Core

The primary focus of the Click Stream Core lies in offering a free-to-play gaming platform, where users who may spend minimal time engaging with the platform stand a chance to win real money prizes. The responsibility for ensuring compliance with relevant gaming regulations and verifying user eligibility remains with the platform operators.

original: Our games will initially be quick to play quiz type games that allows the user to get involved in around 20 seconds, and then receive results from push notifications. Game types are set up dynamically with live game shows with Hosts 2 – 4 times per month. Because the format doesn’t change, we can run games nightly for NBA to NHL, NFL to individual events such as the Oscars, other awards shows, and new sporting events such as Soccer and Nascar.
ollama_generated: The interactive quiz-style games offered by us are designed to provide quick and engaging experiences within approximately 20 seconds, with instantaneous results delivered via push notifications. Our game selection will be regularly updated, featuring live game shows hosted by various personalities at least twice a week. While the fundamental structure of our games remains consistent, we may adjust the content to cater to daily events ranging from major sports leagues such as NBA, NHL, and NFL, to individual events like the Oscars, awards shows, and novel sporting events including Soccer and NASCAR. It is important to note that while we strive to provide a diverse range of games, the frequency or type of content may occasionally be subject to unforeseen circumstances or changes in scheduling.

original: Business model- What sets our platform apart from other platforms in this untapped casual industry is that we have winners win significant amounts of money via time breakers, timing of inputting answers etc. Competitor platforms pay out an average of a few dollars. Our winners are more top loaded and pay out around $2,500 per the top 5 and $1,000 per the top 10.
ollama_generated:
Business Model - Distinctively, our platform excels in the casual industry due to its unique structure where winners potentially reap substantial rewards, primarily through strategic time management and prompt response times for answer submission. Unlike competitor platforms that typically distribute relatively small payouts averaging a few dollars, our payout system is skewed towards a smaller number of winners, with the top 5 earning approximately $2,500 each and the top 10 receiving around $1,000 apiece.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the focus slightly by emphasizing that our winners are 'potentially' reaping substantial rewards, highlighting that not everyone may win large amounts but those who do can potentially receive significant payouts. Additionally, I used the phrase 'our payout system is skewed towards a smaller number of winners', which implies a higher likelihood of fewer winners receiving larger payouts compared to the original clause where it was stated that the top 5 and top 10 winners receive certain amounts, implying all 5 and 10 winners will receive those amounts.

original: 8 │ Page Source: CLICKSTREAM CORP, 1-A, 3/30/2020 Eventually the platform will expand into affiliate sales of products and once the audience has grown large enough, peer to peer betting.
ollama_generated:

It is not guaranteed, however, that these features will be introduced or made available to the audience unless and until a significant growth in our user base is achieved.

This revision weakens the obligation to implement affiliate sales and peer-to-peer betting by making it contingent on achieving a significant growth in the user base. This modification emphasizes that these features are potential additions, but their introduction is not guaranteed or mandatory at any given point.
